Additionally, our loans are backed with insurance to cover risks such as death and fire.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Field Recovery Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full-time
Area of coverage: Ijaiye, Egbeda and Sango

Job Description


	Recover bad debts from debtors who show an unwillingness to pay back the loan taken.
	Conduct regular reviews and visits to clients with outstanding loan portfolios at risk.
	Daily review of all the outstanding and overdue loan clients.
	Make regular reports and suggestions to the bank on actions required to protect its funds from bad loan clients.
	Recovery of classified loans.
	Initiates the process to prosecute hardcore debtors in line with the guiding bank policy,
	Negotiate work out plans with willing debtors.
	Liaise with branches to manage and monitor non-performing loans.
	Any other responsibilities that may be assigned by the immediate supervisor.


Job Requirements


	Candidates should possess an HND or a B.Sc Degree
	1 &ndash; 3 Years of experience in Recovery in a Microfinance Institution
	Excellent communication skills
	Good analytical and negotiation skills with experience
	Great planning and multitasking skills to ensure the delivery of excellent jobs
	Exceptional interpersonal skills, listening skills and ability to communicate and negotiate with debtors
	Articulate and result-oriented
	High level of integrity
	Ability to keep records and be a great team player
	Must possess a strong methodical approach to complete the assigned task
	Accurate, organised and motivated
	Previous loan recovery experience.


Benefits


	HMO cover
	Pension plan
	13th Month Salary
	Performance Incentive
	Transport Allowance.


Method of Application&nbsp;

  "title": "Inventory Officer",
  "description": "Ascentech Services Limited is a full-fledged Human Resource Solution Provider incorporated in 2013 with its Head Office in Lagos, Nigeria. We are committed to forging long-term partnerships with our clients by creating and delivering robust and flexible services that address the changing needs of their business.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Inventory Officer&nbsp;

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a detail-oriented and experienced Inventory Officer to manage and oversee inventory operations at our facility in Lagos.
	The ideal candidate must have hands-on experience in industrial manufacturing and chemical distribution, with a strong understanding of safety procedures, stock management, and warehouse coordination.
	This role ensures accurate inventory records, efficient stock movement, compliance with regulatory standards, and smooth operational flow.


Key Responsibilities


	Inventory Management
	Maintain accurate records of all stock items, including raw materials, chemicals, finished products, and packaging materials.
	Conduct regular stock counts, cycle counts, and reconciliation to ensure accuracy.
	Monitor stock levels and initiate timely replenishment requests to prevent shortages or overstocking.
	Track product expiries, batch numbers, and shelf-life indicators, especially for chemicals.
	Warehouse Coordination
	Oversee the safe receipt, storage, and dispatch of materials in compliance with industrial and chemical handling regulations.
	Ensure proper labelling, segregation, and storage based on chemical properties and manufacturing standards.
	Supervise loading and offloading activities, ensuring proper documentation and safety compliance.
	Reporting &amp; Documentation
	Prepare daily, weekly, and monthly inventory reports for management review.
	Update inventory databases, ERP systems, and stock movement records accurately.
	Work closely with procurement, production, and quality teams to ensure seamless inventory flow.
	Compliance &amp; Safety
	Ensure adherence to safety guidelines for handling hazardous and non-hazardous chemicals.
	Maintain compliance with industry regulations, environmental standards, and internal SOPs.
	Participate in safety trainings, audits, and quality assurance checks.
	Operational Support
	Investigate and report discrepancies, damages, or losses.
	Support production planning by providing accurate materials availability data.
	Recommend improvements to inventory processes and warehouse efficiency.


Requirements


	Proven experience as an Inventory Officer or Storekeeper in industrial manufacturing and chemical distribution (required).
	Experience in industrial manufacturing and a chemical&nbsp;distribution company
	Strong knowledge of chemical handling, warehouse procedures, and safety regulations.
	Proficiency with inventory software, ERP systems, and Microsoft Office tools.
	Excellent numerical accuracy, attention to detail, and record-keeping skills.
	Strong organizational, communication, and teamwork abilities.
	Ability to work in a fast-paced, structured industrial environment.


Salary
N200,000 - N250,000 per month.

Method of Application&nbsp;

Inventory Officer Job at Ascentech Services Limited




        
    

        
        Ascentech Services Limited is a full-fledged Human Resource Solution Provider incorporated in 2013 with its Head Office in Lagos, Nigeria. We are committed to forging long-term partnerships with our clients by creating and delivering robust and flexible services that address the changing needs of their business.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Inventory Officer 

Job Location: Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a detail-oriented and experienced Inventory Officer to manage and oversee inventory operations at our facility in Lagos.
	The ideal candidate must have hands-on experience in industrial manufacturing and chemical distribution, with a strong understanding of safety procedures, stock management, and warehouse coordination.
	This role ensures accurate inventory records, efficient stock movement, compliance with regulatory standards, and smooth operational flow.


Key Responsibilities


	Inventory Management
	Maintain accurate records of all stock items, including raw materials, chemicals, finished products, and packaging materials.
	Conduct regular stock counts, cycle counts, and reconciliation to ensure accuracy.
	Monitor stock levels and initiate timely replenishment requests to prevent shortages or overstocking.
	Track product expiries, batch numbers, and shelf-life indicators, especially for chemicals.
	Warehouse Coordination
	Oversee the safe receipt, storage, and dispatch of materials in compliance with industrial and chemical handling regulations.
	Ensure proper labelling, segregation, and storage based on chemical properties and manufacturing standards.
	Supervise loading and offloading activities, ensuring proper documentation and safety compliance.
	Reporting & Documentation
	Prepare daily, weekly, and monthly inventory reports for management review.
	Update inventory databases, ERP systems, and stock movement records accurately.
	Work closely with procurement, production, and quality teams to ensure seamless inventory flow.
	Compliance & Safety
	Ensure adherence to safety guidelines for handling hazardous and non-hazardous chemicals.
	Maintain compliance with industry regulations, environmental standards, and internal SOPs.
	Participate in safety trainings, audits, and quality assurance checks.
	Operational Support
	Investigate and report discrepancies, damages, or losses.
	Support production planning by providing accurate materials availability data.
	Recommend improvements to inventory processes and warehouse efficiency.


Requirements


	Proven experience as an Inventory Officer or Storekeeper in industrial manufacturing and chemical distribution (required).
	Experience in industrial manufacturing and a chemical distribution company
	Strong knowledge of chemical handling, warehouse procedures, and safety regulations.
	Proficiency with inventory software, ERP systems, and Microsoft Office tools.
	Excellent numerical accuracy, attention to detail, and record-keeping skills.
	Strong organizational, communication, and teamwork abilities.
	Ability to work in a fast-paced, structured industrial environment.


Salary
N200,000 - N250,000 per month.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: cv@ascentech.com.ng using “Inventory Officer – Lagos” as the subject of the mail.

	We are seeking a Creative Personal Assistant to provide administrative, creative, and brand support to the CEO.
